comment: This is one of the best professors I have ever had in my college career. He is so caring, and always willing to help. The content in his class was amazing. It has helped me so much as a professional and as a teacher. He will go above and beyond to make sure his students are successful. 10/10 highly recommend.
Dr. Dias is a fountain of knowledge! He has high expectations for his stude ts but will always help you get there. He is flexible on due dates if you need more time. I learned a ton in his class!

He is very understanding, very flexible, and very open. Things change and he went with the flow of the classroom and what was happening to us. Especially with COVID, he didn't make life harder for me. He made things feel like it was possible and I could breathe. If something was turned in a day late, then oh well, as long as I did good work.

I think that Dr. Diass greatest strength may lie in his sincere desire to teach, and not just this class, but to teach students in general. His enthusiasm and willingness to share his knowledge was evident throughout this course. In short, Dr. Michael Dias has been one of the best educators that I have had a chance to meet. Phenomenal professor!

Dr Dias was always at Osborne when I was there and the other students said he was there with them also. This seems like a great deal of extra time for him to be over there because many of us had to be there at different times and days but he did emphasize that he is always available for us. He had great insights and suggestions for ways to address.

Dr. Dias is a wonderful teacher. He is smart, kind, empathetic, and generous with his time. He has an infectious warmth that reveals how much he cares for his teachersintraining and the students we will one day serve. I consider myself lucky to have him as a mentor.

Dr Dias convinced me to stick with the course and give the new ideas and concepts a chance when I initially wanted to go ahead and change majors. The new methods in education were so different from what I grew up in that my first response was that I am too old to learn these new concepts. He convinced me to stay the course and decide after I had co

Dr. Dias is one of the best professors I have had at KSU. He truly is passionate about science and makes learning it fun! Yo I do have pop quizzes but he gives you a study guide which is almost identical to the quiz so if you study you will make an A in his class. He is truly a great Professor!
Great professor, truly cares about his students and them learning the material. Would highly recommend taking him!

Dr. Dias is the most passionate professors I've had. He knows so much about science & loves it so much & this shows in his teaching style. He can be a bit scattered but puts notes and info on D2L before class and always answers questions and makes sure you understand. 3 exams, got A's on all of them, plus a final, a project and multiple quizzes.

He's a great professor. Cares so much about his students, and loves his profession. Inspirational and helpful. Dr. Dias is so sweet and he truly wants you to learn information to carry into your teaching career.
Probably the best professor I ever had. He truly shows he cares and will help in any way.
Responsive to emails and questions. Wonderful about clearing up confusion. Respectful and professional.

Dr. Dias was probably the best instructor I had, as far as teacher-student communication goes. He always reached out to us with responses to questions that others had asked, as he knew we would find the answers valuable. I appreciated that he was in constant contact with us- this is something online professors need to do better at in this program.

In all seriousness, I like the guy as a person. He's kind and funny. But he is one of the worst professors I've had. He's unorganized, he doesn't often complete his thoughts/explanations, and he often confuses due dates. Taking his BED 3421 class has been an extraordinary challenge because of his disorganization.
Well organized and very caring teacher.
I enjoyed what Dr. Dias brought to the table. He always tried to keep us engaged with a variety of strategies.

Dr. Dias was a great professor. Every day he worked to keep us engaged and to provide us with relevant assignments. He will make you work hard and he is a tough grader. However, he will also give you feedback and opportunities to improve. I really enjoyed his class and got a lot out of it.

OMG where to begin this guy doesn't know what he is doing. spends too much time rambling when we could be going over material for a test. he wants to help don't get me wrong but um i don't know and the test are pretty hardTry to pass b/c if is u are just .3 points away he will not pass you
He is a great Instructor.  If you study you will do great in his class.  He gives you everything you need to study.  He is very helpful.

Dr. Dias posts his powerpoints, so you can print them off and bring them to class. Dr. Dias was very unsure of his teaching ablilities and reminded us on a daily basis. Labs weren't as interresting as they could be. Tests were really hard, but other grades could bring up your grade.
Mike Dias is a great mentor!
